dimension_explanations.alignment: The foundation shows moderate alignment with a score of 29/50, primarily driven by its high donor fit for those seeking zakat-eligible causes [2]. It supports specific asnaf categories and offers multiple donation channels to accommodate religious giving requirements [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: While the foundation directs 95.7% of its $233,066 total revenue toward programs like HEAL and Clean Water, its financial health is strained by a working capital deficit of -6.1 months [3]. The impact score of 22/50 reflects a direct provision model that currently operates with a high cost per beneficiary and low data confidence [4].

credibility.explanation: Credibility is currently limited by the organization's <cite id="17">recent founding in 2023</cite> and a <cite id="9">lack of third-party transparency seals</cite>. While <cite id="3">IRS filings are available</cite>, the small board size presents a governance risk.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">95.7% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.
Humaniti Foundation reports spending <cite id="5">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring maximum donor capital reaches the field.
The foundation is <cite id="7">verified as zakat-eligible</cite> and distributes funds across <cite id="8">all eight traditional asnaf categories</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Humaniti Foundation's primary strength lies in its financial leaness and direct grantmaking capacity. In 2023, the organization distributed <cite id="11">$877,690 in total grants</cite>, with significant support going to partners like <cite id="12">Fajr Scientific ($500,000)</cite> and <cite id="13">Good Gifts ($301,600)</cite>. This model allows the foundation to act as a high-efficiency conduit for humanitarian capital. Furthermore, its <cite id="3">revenue of $233,066</cite> is supplemented by a strong asset base, with <cite id="14">total assets reported at $306,342</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2023, the Humaniti Foundation is a U.S.-based non-profit organization dedicated to <cite id="1">raising funds and making distributions for charitable purposes</cite>. The organization focuses on critical humanitarian sectors, specifically through its <cite id="2">HEAL and Clean Water programs</cite>, alongside emergency relief and orphan care. Despite being a relatively new institution, it has established a significant operational footprint, reporting <cite id="3">$233,066 in total revenue</cite> during its 2023 tax year. The foundation operates with a lean financial model, reporting a <cite id="4">95.7% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="5">zero fundraising costs</cite>, meaning every dollar raised is directed toward its core missions. Humaniti Foundation serves a broad international scope, with geographic coverage spanning <cite id="6">Sudan, Gaza, Pakistan, Yemen, and Somalia</cite>, among other regions. As a <cite id="7">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, it provides a structured pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill religious obligations, specifically serving <cite id="8">eight categories of asnaf</cite>, including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin). While the organization shows high financial efficiency in its spending ratios, it is currently in an early maturity stage with <cite id="9">limited third-party transparency data</cite> and a small governing board.
